Sentence: Differential transcription in Ascaris suum was investigated using a genomic - bioinformatic approach .

Sentence: A cDNA archive enriched for molecules in the infective third - stage larva ( L3 ) of A . suum was constructed by suppressive - subtractive hybridization ( SSH ) , and a subset of cDNAs from 3075 clones subjected to microarray analysis using cDNA probes derived from RNA from different developmental stages of A . suum .

Sentence: Syndrome of arachnomelia in Simmental cattle
NER: O O O O O B

Sentence: Abstract
NER: O

Sentence: Background
NER: O

Sentence: The syndrome of arachnomelia is an inherited malformation mainly of limbs , back and head in cattle .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O

Sentence: At present the arachnomelia syndrome has been well known mainly in Brown Swiss cattle .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O

Sentence: Nevertheless , the arachnomelia syndrome had been observed in the Hessian Simmental population during the decade 1964 - 1974 .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Recently , stillborn Simmental calves were observed having a morphology similar to the arachnomelia syndrome .
NER: O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The goal of this work was the characterization of the morphology and genealogy of the syndrome in Simmental to establish the basis for an effective management of the disease .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Results
NER: O

Sentence: The first pathologically confirmed arachnomelia syndrome - cases in the current Simmental population appeared in the year 2005 .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: By 2007 , an additional 140 calves with the arachnomelia syndrome were identified .
NER: O O O O O O B O O O O O O O

Sentence: The major pathological findings were malformed bones affecting the head , long bones of the legs and the vertebral column .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It could be shown that , with the exception of two cases that were considered as phenocopies , all of the paternal and about two - third of the maternal pedigrees of the affected calves could be traced back to one common founder .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Together with the data from experimental matings , the pedigree data support an autosomal recessive mutation being the etiology of the arachnomelia syndrome .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The frequency of the mutation in the current population was estimated to be 3 . 32 % .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Conclusion
NER: O

Sentence: We describe the repeated occurrence of the arachnomelia syndrome in Simmental calves .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O B O

Sentence: It resembles completely the same defect occurring in the Brown Swiss breed .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The mutation became relatively widespread amongst the current population .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Therefore , a control system has to be established and it is highly desirable to map the disease and develop a genetic test system .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Background
NER: O

Sentence: In the year 2006 a syndrome was described in the German and Austrian Simmental ( Fleckvieh , as it is locally called , is the main dual - purpose breed in Germany , in short called Simmental in the further text ) population , that was pathologically similar to the arachnomelia syndrome in Brown Swiss cattle [ 1 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O

Sentence: The congenital arachnomelia syndrome ( AS , OMIA Phene ID 139 , Group 000059 ) is mainly a malformation of the skeletal system in cattle that was initially described by Rieck and Schade [ 2 ] in Holstein Friesian , Red Holstein and Simmental .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The main pathological changes are skeletal malformations of the legs , the spinal column and the skull .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The legs are thinner and appear longer than normal ( dolichostenomelia , arachnomelia ) since the diameter of the diaphyses is reduced .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: These long bones are more fragile and , in combination with stiffened joints , they tend to fracture during calving .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The fetlock joints are deformed , often stiffened and show hyperextension .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The malformation of the spinal column leads to kyphosis and scoliosis .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The skull malformations are characterized by a shortened lower jaw ( brachygnathia inferior ) , convex rounding of the frontal bone leading to a marked stop ( " pointer head " ) and rotation of the anterior cranium .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In some cases , additional malformations like hydrocephalus externus develop [ 2 - 5 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Since the report of Rieck and Schade [ 2 ] no further cases were reported in Simmental cattle , but in the 1980s the syndrome was dispersed in another breed , the European Brown Swiss cattle , by the use of American Brown Swiss sires [ 4 , 6 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In Brown Swiss an autosomal recessive mode of inheritance was supposed and a control program based on the identification of carriers by pedigree analyses was established [ 5 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Recently , four cases of arachnomelia syndrome were reported in Italy [ 3 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In this study , we present the data of 152 pathologically confirmed cases of arachnomelia syndrome in Simmental that were collected from October 2005 to March 2007 .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: We describe the pathological findings , the familial occurrence and an estimate of the frequency of the diseases allele in Simmental cattle .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O

Sentence: Additional support for the mode of inheritance and the genetic basis of the arachnomelia syndrome is given by the result of experimental matings of obligate carriers .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Results and discussion
NER: O O O

NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In autumn 2004 a number of stillborn calves with similar malformations of the legs and head were recorded within the monitoring system of anomalies in Simmental .
NER: O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Efficacy of intra - articular hyaluronan ( Synvisc ( R ) ) for the treatment of osteoarthritis affecting the first metatarsophalangeal joint of the foot ( hallux limitus ) : study protocol for a randomised placebo controlled trial

Sentence: Abstract
NER: O

Sentence: Background
NER: O

Sentence: Osteoarthritis of the first metatarsophalangeal joint ( MPJ ) of the foot , termed hallux limitus , is common and painful .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Numerous non - surgical interventions have been proposed for this disorder , however there is limited evidence for their efficacy .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Intra - articular injections of hyaluronan have shown beneficial effects in case - series and clinical trials for the treatment of osteoarthritis of the first metatarsophalangeal joint .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: However , no study has evaluated the efficacy of this form of treatment using a randomised placebo controlled trial .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This article describes the design of a randomised placebo controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of intra - articular hyaluronan ( Synvisc ( R ) ) to reduce pain and improve function in people with hallux limitus .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O

Sentence: Methods
NER: O

Sentence: One hundred and fifty community - dwelling men and women aged 18 years and over with hallux limitus ( who satisfy inclusion and exclusion criteria ) will be recruited .

Sentence: Background
NER: O

Sentence: Osteoarthritis ( OA ) is a degenerative joint disease that commonly presents within the first metatarsophalangeal joint ( MPJ ) of the foot .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The terms hallux limitus and hallux rigidus have frequently been used interchangeably to describe differing severities of pain and limitation of motion associated with OA at the first MPJ [ 1 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Hallux limitus is a progressive osteoarthritic condition of the first MPJ that may advance to an end - stage presentation of hallux rigidus where the joint fuses and there is a complete restriction of motion [ 1 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: First MPJ OA is the second most common disorder affecting the foot after hallux valgus [ 2 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The prevalence of the condition increases with age , and it has been reported that radiographic changes in the first MPJ affect are evident in approximately 46 % of women and 32 % of men at 60 years of age [ 3 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Osteoarthritis at the first MPJ is characterised by the symptoms of pain and stiffness at the joint [ 1 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Secondary painful symptoms relate to compensations during gait that may occur due to the reduced motion of the first MPJ [ 1 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The presence of pain associated with first MPJ OA impacts on normal walking and quality of life [ 4 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Treatment of hallux limitus involves conservative measures ( such as physical therapy , foot orthoses , footwear modification , joint manipulation and injection with corticosteroid ) [ 5 ] , or surgical intervention ( either joint - salvage or joint - destructive procedures ) [ 6 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Pharmacological treatment is also often undertaken as an adjunct for pain relief in the management of hallux limitus [ 6 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: However , although non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) and cyclooxygenase - 2 inhibitors have been found to be effective in the management of various forms of OA , gastrointestinal complications remain a concern [ 7 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In light of these limitations with existing treatments , an alternative treatment termed ' viscosupplementation ' - the intra - articular injection of hyaluronan into arthritic joints with the aim of restoring the viscoelasticity of the synovial fluid [ 8 ] - has been proposed and has attracted considerable attention in the medical literature as a treatment for OA [ 9 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In particular , both the American College of Rheumatology ( ACR ) and European League Against Rheumatism ( EULAR ) recommend hyaluronan in the management of OA of the knee [ 10 , 11 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Although the results of systematic reviews investigating the effectiveness of this type of treatment for knee OA are controversial , the most recent update of the Cochrane systematic review evaluating viscosupplementation for the treatment of knee OA concluded that viscosupplementation was both safe and effective for the treatment of OA and was superior or equivalent to any form of systemic intervention or intra - articular corticosteroids [ 9 , 12 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Despite there being a large number of studies investigating the effectiveness of hyaluronan for knee OA , few studies have investigated the effects of this form of treatment for OA at the first MPJ [ 13 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In a case - series retrospective study , 14 patients with radiographically confirmed OA at the first MPJ that received up to 3 intra - articular injections of 1 ml hyaluronan ( Ostenil ( R ) Mini ) ( sodium hyaluronate ) reported a statistically significant reduction in pain ( reported using a visual analogue scale ) after 6 months [ 14 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In another study , Pons et al [ 13 ] compared a single intra - articular injection of 1 ml Ostenil ( R ) Mini ( sodium hyaluronate ) with 1 ml Trigon depot ( R ) ( triamcinolone acetonide , a corticosteroid ) for the treatment of painful , grade 1 hallux limitus ( Karasick and Wapner [ 15 ] scale ) in 37 participants ( 40 feet ) [ 13 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O

Sentence: However , hyaluronan treatment resulted in a statistically significant greater reduction in pain during walking and greater improvement in the American Orthopaedic Foot and Ankle Society ( AOFAS ) hallux MPJ score compared to treatment with triamcinolone acetonide .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Accordingly , the aims of this project are to conduct a double blind randomised controlled trial to determine the effectiveness of intra - articular hyaluronan ( Synvisc ( R ) ) on ( i ) foot pain and function ; ( ii ) the range of motion of the first MPJ ; ( iii ) the strength of the plantarflexor muscles of the first MPJ ; ( iv ) the health related quality of life ; and ( v ) the use of pain - relieving medications in people with hallux limitus .

Sentence: Abstract
NER: O

Sentence: A direct hybridization protocol is described for screening cosmid and yeast artificial chromosome libraries with pools of Alu - PCR products from somatic cell or irradiation hybrids .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This method eliminates purification , cloning and analysis of each individual Alu - PCR product before library screening .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A series of human X chromosome irradiation hybrids were mapped by this method , using a cosmid reference library for comparisons between overlapping hybrids to identify interesting clones for further analysis . Images

NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: ABSTRACT
NER: O

Sentence: A direct hybridization protocol is described for screening cosmid and yeast artificial chromosome libraries with pools of Alu - PCR products from somatic cell or irradiation hybrids .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This method eliminates purification , cloning and analysis of each individual AluPCR product before library screening .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A series of human X chromosome irradiation hybrids were mapped by this method , using a cosmid reference library for comparisons between overlapping hybrids to identify interesting clones for further analysis .
NER: O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: INTRODUCTION
NER: O

Sentence: The generation of human DNA probes specific for individual chromosomes and subregions of chromosomes has been advanced with Alu - sequence primed polymerase chain reaction amplification ( Alu - PCR , 1 - 3 ) .
NER: O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This method specifically amplifies sequences between Alu repeats from human DNA in somatic cell hybrids and yeast artificial chromosomes ( YACs , 4 ) .
NER: O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Individual Alu - PCR products can be purified from agarose gels or ligated into plasmid vectors to screen for single copy sequences .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Unique Alu - PCR products are then localized to certain chromosome regions using DNA blots of somatic cell hybrid panels .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Once localized , Alu - PCR fragments can be screened against genomic libraries to isolate longer DNA fragments from the region of interest .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: As an alternative to this multistep process we have developed a hybridization protocol for screening of cosmid and YAC libraries directly with pools of Alu - PCR products .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Two new human specific Alu primers were used to generate DNA probes from a series of irradiation - reduced hybrids containing multiple human X chromosome fragments of 1 - 2000 kb on a hamster chromosome background ( 5 ; P . N . G . , unpublished ) .
NER: O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The Alu - PCR products were hybridized as a pool of probes to X - specific cosmid and YAC libraries , after
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: competitive reassociation with an excess of human DNA to both the library filters and radioactively labelled Alu - PCR products .
NER: O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Comparisons were made between clones identified by overlapping irradiation hybrids and single copy DNA probes hybridized to the cosmid and YAC libraries .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: METHODS
NER: O

Sentence: Two human Alu sequence primers were generated which were shown to be human specific ; 3144 from the 3 ' end of Alu : 5 ' - GAGCGAGACTCCGTCTCAAA - 3 ' and 2729 from the 5 ' end of Alu : 5 ' - GTGGATCACCTGAGGTCAGG - 3 ' .
NER: O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: All PCR reactions were carried out with 100 ng of hybrid DNA and 0 . 7 , ^ g of a single Alu primer in 100 d41 of 0 . 01 M Tris - HCl pH 8 . 3 , 0 . 0015 M MgCl2 , 0 . 05 M KCI , 200 AtM each of dNTPs , 10 % dimethlysulfoxide , and 2 . 5 units of Cetus Taq polymerase .

Sentence: Reactions were 30 cycles of 94 ? C for 2 min , 57 ? C for 2 min , and 74 ? C for 4 min followed by a final extension time at 74 ? C for 9 min .

Sentence: Reactions products were analyzed on 1 % agarose gels and shown to contain between five and twenty fragments , with sizes ranging from 0 . 1 to 2 . 0 kb .

Sentence: How can Health Behavior Theory be made more useful for intervention research ?
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Abstract
NER: O

Sentence: Background
NER: O

Sentence: The present paper expresses the author ' s views about the practical utility of Health Behavior Theory for health behavior intervention research .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The views are skeptical and perhaps even a bit exaggerated .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are , however , also based on 20 - plus years of in - the - trenches research focused on improving health behavior practice through research .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Discussion
NER: O

Sentence: The author ' s research has been theoretically driven and has involved measurement of varying variables considered to be important theoretical mediators and moderators of health behavior .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Regretfully , much of this work has found these variables wanting in basic scientific merit .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Health Behavior Theory as we have known it over the last 25 years or so has been dominated by conceptualizations of behavior change processes that highlight cognitive decision - making .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Although much of health behavior practice targets what people do rather than what they think , the logic of focusing on thoughts is that what people think about is the key to what they will do in the future , and that interventions that can measure and harness those processes will succeed to a greater extent than those that do not .
NER: O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Unfortunately , in the author ' s experience , the premise of cognitive theories has fallen short empirically in a number of ways .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The cognitive schemata favored by most health behavior theories are difficult to measure , they do not predict behavioral outcomes very well , there is little evidence that they cause behavior , and they are hard to change directly .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Summary
NER: O

Sentence: It is suggested that health behavior researchers reconsider their use of these theories in favor of models whose variables are more accessible to observation and experimental manipulation and that most importantly have strong empirical support .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Background
NER: O

Sentence: The author has been conducting research on behavioral treatment of obesity for about 25 years .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: During that time , the dominant conceptual models guiding intervention development have been cognitive behavior models that have their origin in psychological theory .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Those most often cited include the Health Belief Model [ 1 ] , Protection Motivation Theory [ 2 ] , Subjective Expected Utility Theory [ 3 ] , the Theory of Reasoned Action [ 4 ] , Social Cognitive Theory [ 5 ] , and the Transtheoretical Model [ 6 ] .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: All of these theories are concerned with how people make behavioral choices and the general idea is that people decide what to do based on the extent to which they expect that their choices will produce results that they value .

Sentence: Much of the content of the theories is concerned with factors that may affect value / expectancy calculations .
NER: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: As summarized by Weinstein in a comparative review of four social psychological theories [ 7 ] , variables thought to influence value / expectancy judgments include such factors as perceived rewards of current behavior , self - efficacy , normative beliefs , motivation , and the perceived consequences of not changing behavior .
